title: Robust Stratified Sampling Plans for Low Selectivity Queries.
abstract: We consider the problem of estimating the result of an aggregate query with a very low selectivity. Traditional sampling techniques can be ineffective for such a problem since a small random sample is likely to miss most or even all of the records satisfying the restrictive selection predicate. Stratfied sampling is useful in this situation, but a key problem in applying stratified sampling effectively is identifying which strata are important and developing a sampling plan that favors those strata in a robust fashion. We develop a solution to this problem that combines any prior knowledge or expectation about the stratification with information obtained from pilot sampling in a principled Bayesian framework.
